verses.text: Deliver me, O \sc Lord\sc*, from the evil man: Preserve me from the violent man;
Which imagine mischiefs in \add their\add* heart; Continually are they gathered together \add for\add* war.
They have sharpened their tongues like a serpent; Adderâ€™s poison \add is\add* under their lips. Selah.
Keep me, O \sc Lord\sc*, from the hands of the wicked; Preserve me from the violent man; Who have purposed to overthrow my goings.
The proud have hid a snare for me, and cords; They have spread a net by the way side; They have set grins for me. Selah.
I said unto the \sc Lord\sc*, Thou \add art\add* my God: Hear the voice of my supplications, O \sc Lord\sc*.
O \sc God\sc* the Lord, the strength of my salvation, Thou hast covered my head in the day of battle.
Grant not, O \sc Lord\sc*, the desires of the wicked: Further not his wicked device; \add Lest\add* they exalt themselves. Selah.
\add As for\add* the head of those that compass me about, Let the mischief of their own lips cover them.
Let burning coals fall upon them: Let them be cast into the fire; Into deep pits, \add that\add* they rise not up again.
Let not an evil speaker be established in the earth: Evil shall hunt the violent man to overthrow \add him\add*.
I know that the \sc Lord\sc* will maintain the cause of the afflicted, \add And\add* the right of the poor.
Surely the righteous shall give thanks unto thy name: The upright shall dwell in thy presence.
